title: What is your opinion on Greek literature? - Quora

response.answer_text: As in, contemporary Greek literature? I have my favorites, but the whole scene has been suffering from a case of same-old same-old. It feels impossible to escape from a basic number of plots that keep getting recycled; Male author stand-in negotiates life through the late-60s/early-70s military dictatorship. Does a lot of sex.Male author stand-in negotiates life through the Greek civil war. Does a lot of sex.Female author stand-in negotiates life through a world war and/or the Asia Minor disaster. Does a lot of illicit sex.Lately, there's been a new plot in the form of the Author stand-in negotiating life during the 2008 financial crisis. No one's having any sex. I'm a big fan of what Mexican and New Weird authors, especially Yuri Herrera and Jeff Vandermeer, do with fiction and I find Greek literature's obsession with picking apart our collective past tiring. Having said that, Nikos Mantis transcends all that and I live for the day when he'll get translated in other languages. I also have a soft spot for Vasilis Alexakis. He is something of an aberration in Greek literature, as he writes from a very specific emigré perspective that is not particularly represented. If anyone has any different opinions, please give me your recommendations. I'd love to check them out.
I’m firmly of the opinion that it exists. Not a doubt in my mind. Like all literature, it varies in quality from writer to writer and work to work.
